Can you make an ice cream flower?ü§î If you have ever made a flower of decorative plaster, you can do it! üòâ

Multi-colored balls of cold dessert in their containers üçß- a colored decorative plaster in transparent jars! A small spoon of ice cream in your hands turns into a palette knife. A waffle cone-a plywood blank, which appears strawberry rose, honey peony or cherry iris.üëç
It is a pity that such a delicious beauty melts quickly...üòã And the same delicious, but durable flowers you can create with the help of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".üòâ All materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" can be purchased on the website specified in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

Does anyone else here love going to thrift stores to find ‚Äú treasures‚Äù ? The other day I came upon one in Reseda and had a ‚Äú eureka! ‚Äú moment when I found a stack of old wooden cutting boards. I bought up a bunch, drove  home fast, got my apron on and started to ‚Äúshabbify‚Äù  them with a wash of gray paint. Then I added a sculptural painted garland and voila! It‚Äôs about 16‚Äù x 12‚Äù ( 41 cm x 31cm). How to grow rose? Just need to learn to comply with the rules: planting, feeding, watering, pruning, cover for the winter. Then not to forget the care:
this loosening of the soil, weeding, fertilizing, watering, fighting diseases and pests, pruning and forming a Bush.
Difficult? Not easy.
‚†Ä
In sculptural painting ‚Äùgrow" a beautiful rose is also not the first time. And only when you have enough experience in your garden begins to bloom a real rose garden of a large number of colors of different shades and breeds!
The rules of ‚Äùgrowing" roses in sculptural painting are: learning techniques, training, practice!
One big plus ‚Äì then no need to water, weed and deal with pests!¬†üòÜüòÜüòÜ

Continue to acquaint you with decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the color "olive".
‚†Ä
This color got its name from the olive ‚Äì an evergreen tree, which is also called olive.
The palette of olive color includes many shades: from transparent grayish to intense yellow-green.
The standard of olive color is considered the color of immature, green olive fruit.
‚†Ä
The science that studies the properties of color, argues that olive, as one of the natural shades, subconsciously causes people a feeling of freshness, tranquility and purity.
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" this color is presented! Rich, natural and soothing!¬†üòâüëç

One of the difficulties that arises for beginners in the technique of sculptural painting is the selection of the color palette of the future work. After all, roses can be not only pure pink! And leaves ‚Äì not only green!
‚†Ä
To create a rose Bud, you can use the colors: ‚ÄúOld pink‚Äú, ‚ÄúRosary‚Äù and "Pink smoke" as the main, adding inclusions of ‚ÄúFrench vanilla‚Äù or ‚ÄúTea rose‚Äù.
You can add a little "Antique white‚Äùand "Lilac". Bright shades of plaster can be mixed with ‚ÄùAntique white" and get more muted colors for the petals.
‚†Ä
For leaves, you can use ‚ÄúPistachio ice cream‚Äú or ‚ÄúSage‚Äù, interspersed with ‚ÄúChocolate‚Äù or ‚ÄúLilac‚Äù for support.
And you can add to the leaves even ‚ÄúRosary‚Äù.
‚†Ä
Do not be afraid to make complex color transitions in petals and leaves! From this finished flower becomes more interesting!¬†üòâüëç

Brush and palette knife - for the artist, hammer-for the sculptor, needle-for the seamstress... These are not just tools for work, they are assistants, on which the final result depends!
‚†Ä
In sculptural painting, the palette knife replaces the brush. Different shape of the blade helps to achieve different effect.
Palette knife can be different in size (from N1 to N24) and in shape - diamond-shaped, trapezoidal, teardrop-shaped, with a pointed or rounded blade.

What is a master class in the technique of sculptural painting?
‚†Ä
You come to class. The teacher provides you with the necessary material, explains the basics of technology, shows you by example and gives to work out.
Sculptural technique is not given the first time.
Only after 8 hours of physical and mental work will your first flower be ready!üòâ
To make it easier for you to study and consolidate the sculptural technique, we have developed a scheme to create colors.
These schemes will help you not only to remember how to create a flower in the classroom, and help in self-consolidation of the material.
‚†Ä
Such schemes will be provided as additional material at master classes, intensives and online courses on sculptural painting of Evgenia Ermilova's schoolüòò

If you decide to create a picture for your home in the technique of sculptural painting, you need to consider a few things: the style and area of the room.
An error in the ratio of the size of the picture and the area of the wall leads to disharmony of the General perception.
‚†Ä
What to consider when choosing a picture size:
üëâ1. What's under the painting?
When choosing the size of the picture you need to look down at the level below and estimate the size of the object over which it will be placed. The width of the picture should be equal to or greater than half the length of the object (bed, table, console).
üëâ2. The area of the room
Small rooms visually become even smaller if you hang a large picture on the wall. For small rooms it is better to use several paintings of medium size.
In large areas, small or medium-sized paintings are lost or look dull. Large areas ‚Äî the large picture!
‚†Ä

Hello dears! And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Ivanovo.¬†üôã
Criticism for a creative person is a painful topic. Is it possible to benefit from it?ü§î
To hear criticism of his work-a knife to the heart!üò•¬†And it does not matter a month ago, you first took the palette knife in hand or a year.
‚†Ä
Everyone has their own reaction: someone closes and throws attempts, someone decides to do" out of spite", someone ignores, and someone attacks in response...üòâ
‚†Ä
Where's the benefit? And the benefit - in your conclusions from criticism!
‚†Ä
If the criticism is constructive, it gives you a direction for further creative growth. Lower your emotions and you will see that it will help you do a better job!¬†üëç
‚†Ä
Well, not constructive criticism should simply be ignored. Don't waste your time, emotions and energy on it!
‚†Ä
The main thing is to learn to see the differenceüòâ¬†How do you react to criticism?üëáüëáüëá
‚†Ä

In sculptural painting there are a number of popular colors that do everything! The first place in this list is occupied by rosesüåπüåπüåπ
‚†Ä
And so cool to meet the work with less popular, but no less interesting and beautiful colors!
‚†Ä
The photo of hydrangeas from my partner from Greece @sculptural_painting_greece üëè
‚†Ä
The word "hydrangea" comes from the Greek word "Hydor" which means "water"and the word "angos" which means vessel. If literally translated, the hydrangea means water vessel.
‚†Ä
The meaning of the flower is contradictory ‚Äî it is coldness and indifference, but also cordiality and sincerity, it is boasting and vanity, but also modesty. Hydrangeas in Japan Express grief, and in other countries they are endowed with the ability to ward off diseases and misfortunes.
How many people ‚Äî so many opinions, but the elegance and beauty of hydrangea undeniable.üòç

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Krasnodar.üôã
I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the color "Rust"üòâ
‚†Ä
Rust is a red-brown coating on the surface of iron, formed due to its oxidation under the action of air and moisture. Rusty is a red-orange color, reminiscent of rusty iron.
According to historical sources, the first mention of "rusty" color in the English language refers to 1692.
‚†Ä
The palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" presents two shades of red-orange color: dark and rich "Rust" and bright "Cuprum".
Both colors can be used in pure form, and can be mixed with other shades. When mixed with white plaster, a light shade of color is obtained.
‚†Ä
An example of using the color "Rust" when creating a flower you can see the photo from @my_rose_stories Thanks for the photo!üòâüëç
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the color "mint".üòã
‚†Ä
Mint is the color of combinations of pale blue and light green. Mint color got its name from the plant "mint".
The paradox is that the plant and the mint color only have a common name, not the color itself!¬†üò≥
The plant has a rich green color, more herbal.
Refreshing, cooling and invigorating effect of menthol mint juice-these are the properties that have gone mint shade with the name.
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" color "mint" - light and delicate, it can be used as a pure shade to create a background or leaves, and mixed with other colors to create accents in the work.
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

Details matter! üòâ This phrase is used by a stylist when creating a fashionable image, a designer who certifies the interior, and every experienced handyman! Details are important!
‚†Ä
What is the first important detail in sculptural painting is the background! If the basis for the future picture is poorly created, then the whole picture will not look as it would be desirable in the end.
‚†Ä
Tatiana Doroshenko @tatiana.doroshenko_art, certified teacher of the school "Evgenia Ermilova" tells how not to make a mistake when creating a background with cracks.
‚†Ä
1‚É£ The basis-plywood not less than 6 mm! You know, the thinner the Foundation, the 100% take her!
2‚É£ Cover the Base with soil.
3‚É£Apply the plaster "Crackle" and dry with a Hairdryer! And better 2-are hair dryers! And if there will aides, then in 4 hands! And turn on the hottest mode! A little patience, 30-40 minutes and the effect is ready!
‚†Ä
Thank you Tatiana for the instructions and foto üëç

This girl 10 lessons back for the first time took the knife on her hands. 10 lessons ago, she flew from Estonia to Ivanovo to intensive workshop, completely without knowing whether something would come out of this venture or not ... Indeed, in sculptural painting as, in principle, there is no other way to understand yours or not until you try. And Varya tried! 5 days of intensive and 5 days of individual lessons. And here is the result! I admit the last days I missed, because Varvara @ varvara_ponomarjova_art so easily grasped everything that I almost did not have to help her. And the credit work - hours, she performed with brilliance! I am so happy that I met this positive, purposeful person. And doubly, that she @varvara_ponomarjova_art is now our partner and certified teacher in Estonia. üëçüëçüëç

Often meet at the hashtag #sculpturatus photo with the text: "work in the style of sculptural painting."¬†üò≥
‚†Ä
Sculptural painting is a technique of creating three-dimensional colors (and other images) from three ‚Äì dimensional plaster with a palette knife on the surface on the principle of "one stroke-one element".
‚†Ä
Works in the technique of sculptural painting can be performed in different styles: shabby-chic, Provence, vintage, gunbi... It all depends on the theme of the work, the selected color palette, characteristic elements for styles.
The work may not belong to any known style with a characteristic set of elements. But sculptural painting remains a technique!üòâ
‚†Ä

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from the city of Ivanovo.
Let's look today at two styles that are constantly confused with each other: shabby chic and Provence.
‚†Ä
The main color scheme of styles is similar, because of this they are often confused. Shebby is characterized by pastel colors: pale pink, pale gray, pale green, pale blue, white and ivory.
‚†Ä
In Provence, in addition to the basic colors, dark shades are allowed, and a distinctive feature is the color of lavender. Flowers are the basis of decor of both styles. In Provence, the emphasis is, of course, on lavender, and in shabby ‚Äî on roses.
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" you can find shades to create paintings in both styles!
‚†Ä
For shabby chic - Old pink, Pink smoke, Ash, Ice, Green shabby.
For Provence - Mint, Violet and lLavender mist, Pistachio ice cream and Olive.
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from the city of Ivanovo.üôã
I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the "Coralline" color.
‚†Ä
The word "coral" in Greek means "daughter of the sea".
The coral color is named from this marine animal. Yes, precisely, animal! For a long time, corals were considered plants, but in the 19th century, a French researcher proved that the coral polyp is an animal. Outside the polyp is protected by a calcareous skeleton, and inside a living creature.
‚†Ä
Coral color is at the junction between orange and pink. Depending on the saturation of the main color coral has a wide range of colors: from light orange-red to bright pink-red.
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" "Coralline" color is represented by a rich bright shade.
When mixed with white plaster, you can get a lighter tone.
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

What do you need to develop a creative instagram account?
‚†Ä
When you produce something, it is not enough to make a quality product, you need to present it with dignity. üòâ
This point is very important for the overall impression! If we can make a nice package or a small present for an offline client, what can we do for our online readers?
‚†Ä
Beautiful high-QUALITY photos! It's basic.
‚†Ä
Unfortunately, many creative people in a fit of joy from completing the new work too hurry to share her photo.Bad light, bad angle and lack of composition can spoil the impression of any great work!
‚†Ä
If you want to develop your creative account, if you need new customers, fans of your work or like-minded people from different countries, then pay attention to the photos of your works.¬†‚ò∫Ô∏è

‚†Ä
Poppy (from the Latin Pap√°ver) is a genus of herbaceous plants of the Poppy family. Poppies can be both annual and perennial.
In Russia there are about 75 species of poppies.
‚†Ä
Poppy East ‚Äî a perennial herb. Most often has a bright orange color, but there are other colors. The flower has six petals. Box Oriental poppy framed by delicate stamens is its decoration and contrast to the other species. The Eastern poppy has three sepals. Leaves and stem are shaggy.
‚†Ä
On the online course and master classes we study this type.üëç

Today we get acquainted with the color "Emerald".üòâ
‚†Ä
The color of the grass, the color of spring leaves, lime, marsh green, the color of the apple malachite, color viridan, green fern, turquoise mint, avocado, may green ... All these are names of shades of green!
Emerald is a shade between the color of a green lake and the color of a green snake.üòÜüòÜüòÜ
‚†Ä
In other shades it is difficult to explain the origin of the name. And the emerald color got its from the jewelry stone, known to people from ancient times. Emerald is a green variety of the mineral beryl. It is the purity of the color of the precious emerald that is the main estimated factor of its value.
‚†Ä
The palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" presents emerald green in a bright rich shade.üëç

The sore spot of every creative person is the lack of time! What to do?
Here to help us ‚Äî time management! This is a very broad topic to study.
‚†Ä
Here are examples of ways to free up time:
üëâ1)Delegation of responsibilities.
If you want something done right, do it yourself. Great rule. But in the day only 24 hours and sometimes you have to choose. Prioritize and delegate some of your work.
I delegated the processing of orders, work with clients, sending parcels, etc.
The most important thing: training, recording video lessons and editing I do myself.
‚†Ä
üëâ2)Make a plan in writing.
Time management specialists have calculated that writing a to-do list increases productivity by 25%. You can make a list for a day, week, month, and year. The order is better to build from the more important and urgent to the less important point.So if something does not have time, you can simply move to the next scheduled list.
‚†Ä
And what methods of time management do you use?üëáüëáüëá

‚ö†Ô∏è"–ö–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —Ü–≤–µ—Ç–∞" ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ —Ü–≤–µ—Ç–∞, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–∏–µ—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∞—Ö –∫—Ä—É–≥–∞.

If you have a problem in choosing the colors of decorative plaster for work, then try to use the "color Theory".üòâ
‚†Ä
Color combination rules are necessary for designers, stylists, artists.¬† And, of course, in sculptural painting, you also need to know and use the theory of color combination.
‚†Ä
Here are some of the rules:
‚ö†Ô∏èA "triadic" combination is the use of three equidistant sectors of color on a color wheel.
‚ö†Ô∏è"Complementary colors" are the colors on the opposite sides of the circle.
‚†Ä
Consider for example work with orchids.Which of the rules is used here?
In this work, complementary triadic combination!
The paper used a combination of yellow sector (French vanilla), pink (Rosary) and blue-green (Nifrite).The gray and white colors on the background are neutral shades that blend with everyone.
‚†Ä
Will you try to use the color wheel at work now?

I wrote about laziness this week. Decided to continue this theme and began to look for information.
‚†Ä
The search gives articles on "10 ways to fight laziness", "9 ways to fight laziness"and even" 5 ways to fight laziness.".. The author of the last article, apparently, was too lazy to write about laziness¬†üòÜüòÜüòÜ
‚†Ä
But in each article the main word "to fight".
But if laziness does not have to fight? Our laziness is our choice and our responsibility. Why waste time and energy fighting what we choose?
‚†Ä
Go to the goals and achieve results ‚Äì it's your choice.
Doing nothing is also your choice!
To expend energy on achieving results and the fulfillment of dreams is your decision.
To spend forces for struggle with laziness ‚Äì it is also your decision!
‚†Ä
I choose to achieve goals and go to dreams! Who with me?üòâ

Zhenya had 50 sets for a 5-day intensive course. Each set consists of a plywood base, 4 palette knives, napkins, diagrams with illustrations, cans of sculptural painting and 6000 Gigabytes of information.
Intensive sculptural painting lasts 5 days for 8 hours. At the end of each day from 1 set out 1 finished picture with a flower (rose, peony, iris, poppy and a choice).¬†After 5 days of intensive training, 10 teachers in the technique of sculptural painting are obtained.
ATTENTION!
‚ùì‚ùî‚ùìQuestion: how many finished papers will each new teacher have by the end of the intensive?
And how many Gigabytes of information should each teacher learn for the entire 5-day intensive???

At the online webinar, the students were asked about the finish of the finished works. Decided to tell you who forgot or didn't know.üòâ
‚†Ä
Finished work in the technique of sculptural painting after complete drying is desirable to cover a colorless matte acrylic lacquer.
‚†Ä
Why should the paintings of decorative plaster be varnished? It's simple. For protection from external influences: moisture, dust and ultraviolet. The varnish fills the pores of the plaster and creates a transparent invisible film.
‚†Ä
Paintings in the technique of sculptural painting is not suitable glossy varnish. It spoils the beauty of the picture, creating an artificial reflection. It is better to use matte varnish.
‚†Ä
The range of products of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" has a special acrylic lacquer for sculptural painting.¬†üòâ¬†Absolutely matte. When applied in 1 layer is almost invisible.
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

When you create a flower in the technique of sculptural painting, you need to first understand the structure of flowers. When you know exactly what kind of flower you are doing, you are more correctly building the sequence of work.¬†üòâ
‚†Ä
For example, roses alone have at least six forms of flowers:
üëâgoblet or cone-shaped (classic)
üëâcup-shaped (round and square)
üëâspherical
üëârosette-shaped
üëâflat
üëâpompom shape
‚†Ä
Learn the types of colors and make schemes of their construction!üòâüëç

Rainbows, Waterfalls, Bearded flowers, Iris, cockerels... And it's all about Irises!
‚†Ä
The name of the flower comes from the Greek "iris", which means "rainbow". The flower received its name in ancient Greece by the name of the goddess Irida, who as a messenger of the gods descended on the rainbow to the earth.
In Russia, different types of this flower, according to the dictionary Dahl, called iris, roosters, wolf and bear cucumbers... A bearded irises called having on the outer lobes of the perianth "beard".
‚†Ä
Irises attract us with their unusual, rare for other colors, structure: they have a "two-story" structure.
üëâ"Ground floor" - three outer lobe-shaped perianth lobes, similar to waterfalls.
üëâThe "second floor" is the internal lobes that form the dome or bowl.

How to have time to do all the work?¬†ü§î
‚†Ä
I do not have an exact answer to this question. I also do not always have time to do everything I wanted and planned. But there are time management techniques that help to reduce the number of unfinished business due to lack of time.üòâ
‚†Ä
For example, you can do 2 things at the same time!
‚†Ä
While waiting for a child from school, you can read an informative book. While Ironing clothes, you can watch the training webinar. While running on the treadmill, you can listen to an audio lesson in English. While sitting on a manicure, you can learn the rules of color combination in the phone. While you go to the subway, you can sketch schemes of different varieties of flowers in a notebook.
‚†Ä
If you try, you can come up with more ways to do a few things.üòâ

Delight, panic, despondency, anger, fatigue, and then again delight! @sculpture_paintingüòÑüôÉ
Such emotions and in this order experience when teaching sculptural painting online!
Delight ‚Äî when you look at the lesson, where the magic hands of Evgenia Ermilova¬†@evgenia_ermilova for 1 hour create a beautiful picture with three flowers.
Panic ‚Äî when we take the spatula in his hands and trying as well to magically move a palette knife... And they didn't move at all! And hands, and palette knife, and petals... It's not!
Anger ‚Äî when you stop feeling sorry for yourself and justify yourself, why you do not work out.
Fatigue - when the clock is already 2 a.m., and in the morning it is necessary to send the finished photo to lesson. And we have to keep trying.
Delight ‚Äî when he overcame panic, despair, anger, fatigue and did his homework until the end! And at least SO that HE liked himself.¬†üíÉüíÉüíÉ

‚úÖYour name
‚úÖPhone
‚úÖEmail address

To peonies were not like roses, you need to study the structure of these flowers!üòâ
In the form of a flower, all peonies are divided into five main groups:
üëâ1) not terry peonies - flowers consist of 5-10 large petals arranged in 2 rows.
üëâ2) half terry peonies ‚Äî flowers with 5 or more petals in the Bud, arranged in several rows. Modified stamens in the middle are arranged in a circle and alternate with conventional and petal-shaped stamens.
üëâ3) terry peonies¬†‚Äì flowers with wide petals of flowers arranged in several rows around the center. Many varieties of stamens and pistils modified so that resemble petals.
üëâ4)¬†anemone peonies ‚Äî flowers with 5 or more petals in a Bud, arranged in 2 or more rows. Modified stamens completely occupy the center of the buds.
üëâ5) japanese peonies - are intermediate between¬†not terry peonies  and terry peonies. Their stamens are modified and similar to petals.
Scroll the carousel and view the differences of pions¬†üëâüëâüëâ

I am challenging myself to try new flowers and colors.  Because Pantone‚Äôs ‚ÄúColor of the Year‚Äù is ‚ÄúLiving Coral‚Äù, it seemed fitting to try creating Parrott Tulips using that color. üå∏üå∏For those who have been following my Russian sculptural painting journey from the beginning ( I can‚Äôt believe its almost been one year ago already !) , you will know that I went to Russia two separate times: first to  learn from the originator of sculptural painting, the mega-talented Evgenia Ermilova @evgenia_ermilova and then later to continue studying with one of her prize-pupils, the equally talented Anna Stepochkina @anna_stepochkina_as . üá∑üá∫üá∑üá∫ Much to my surprise, they use completely different techniques! So I feel lucky to now be using my own ‚Äú hybrid‚Äù of both paletteknife work ( Evgenia) and hand-modeling ( Anna). It‚Äôs perfect for me, as I‚Äôm pretty much someone who ‚Äúlikes -too-many-things-‚Äú kind of  person and just can‚Äôt seem to do any one technique alone !üòÇ #sculpture_painting #frenchcountrystyle #shabbylovers #cottagestyle #sculpturalpainting #sculpture_painting_gallery #sculpture_painting #impastopainting #paletteknifepainting #flowerpainting #flowerartist #handmadecrafts #prettythings #–º–∫—Å–∫—É–ª—å–ø—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞—è–∂–∏–≤–æ–ø–∏—Å—å #plastersculpture #tulipsüå∑ #romantichomes #victoriamagazine #pantonecoloroftheyear #fastmotion @evgenia_ermilova_partnership @belleinspirationparis @dannataboutique @sculpture_painting @davidorgell #buttercreamflowers #edibleflowers #atelier #gardenstyle #laartist #pasadena #messyart #mycountryhome #dutchart #amsterdamart #springflowers

Today we get acquainted with the color "Karri".üòâ
The word "Karri" means seasoning from a mixture of spices. But the meaning of this word is much wider!
‚†Ä
The term "curry" in Asia can mean three things:
üëâ1. Spice - curry leaves;
üëâ2. Spice mix ‚Äì curry powder, which contains a whole bunch of different seasonings, including garlic, fenugreek, coriander and others;
üëâ3. Curry dish ‚Äì a thick sauce that can be prepared using a completely different spices and bases (meat, fish, poultry, seafood or vegetables).
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" there is another meaning of the word - the color "Karri". A rich warm yellow hue, similar to the color of a mixture of spices based on turmeric.

‚†Ä
Cattleya Orchid is a genus of perennial herbaceous plants of the Orchid family. The name of the plant was in honor of the British botanist William Cattley, who in 1818 for the first time made these orchids bloom in new climatic conditions.
‚†Ä
The flower consists of three bright sepals and three larger petals, the middle of which (contrasting tone) strongly elongated, resembling a protruding lip or funnel. The edge is wavy. This structure is due to the fact that orchids are pollinated by hummingbirds. The middle petal is a kind of "landing pad" for them.
‚†Ä
Cattleya has a delicate aroma, similar to the smell of Lily of the valley and Lily. But it attracts the attention of an unusual form of flowers with a smooth transition between the shades on the petals.üòç

This week girls from different countries flew to me: China, Taiwan, Egypt, Brazil, Spain and Japan. They all dreamed of learning to sculptural painting, and now their dreams have become a reality. During these days we have already managed to study irises, birds, make hydrangeas and celebrate two birthdays at once.
Today is a rose ...
.

.
Follow our development all week ...

I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
Today we get acquainted with the color "Saffron".
‚†Ä
Saffron is a warm shade of yellow, closer to the orange spectrum. The word "saffron" in Arabic ‚Äî "yellow".
The color derives its name from the orange-colored food spice derived from the dried stigma of saffron flowers. Saffron is considered one of the most expensive spices because of the complexity of production: one flower gives only three stigmas, and to obtain a kilogram of spice requires 200,000 flowers.
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" saffron shade is presented in bright orange yellow.When the plaster dries, the color darkens by half a tone. If you in ready work need to receive a light shade of saffron color, mix plaster "Saffron" with "White".
‚†Ä
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.üòâ

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Ivanovo. üôãAre the accidents that happen in life accidental?
In 1817, the botanist William Swanson, explored the local flora of Brazil and sent several specimens of mosses and lichens to the Botanical garden in Glasgow and to the collector of tropical plants William Cuttleya. The tropical plants in that package were wrapped in thick leaves instead of wrapping paper. The botanist took out the donated plants, and the package of leaves folded in a corner of his greenhouse and forgot. A few months later, Cattley to his surprise found that on forgotten leaves, appeared incredible flowers. He invited specialist John Lindley for a consultation.¬† Lindley determined that the plant in Cattleya is an unknown species of Orchid. And three years later, John Lindley's work "anthology of Botany" was published, in which he described a new species of tropical Orchid called Cattleya maxima.

‚†Ä
The basic principle of the classical art school says ‚Äì to draw or paint a picture should be from the General to the particular, from more to less. It is impossible to draw a nose in detail if you have not outlined the General features of the face. You can not draw one flower, if not sketched outline of the future still life. First, make General sketches, large shapes, then drawing details.
‚†Ä
In sculpture and painting, the palette knife moving from the particular to the next particular. First, too, we estimate the compositional arrangement of future elements. But then, you need to create each element (flower, bird, leaf) from beginning to end. The element must be completed before the plaster dries!¬†üòâ

It has been a month of training on the online course on sculptural painting. Girls have studied a simple flower, iris, poppy, Orchid. This week we create a rose.¬†üòâ
‚†Ä
What do you not know about rose while reading this blog?
‚†Ä
According to archaeological data, the rose has existed on Earth for about 25 million years, and is grown for more than 5,000 years. For so long the story of a rose there are so many stories and legends that you can write a separate book. Here is an interesting legend about the origin of rose thorns.
‚†Ä
üåπCupid, inhaled the scent of a flower and was stung by a bee. Angry, in pain, he shot an arrow at rose, which turned into a thorn.
The scientists ' version is simple and not romantic:
the thorns are the roses for protection. Nature has awarded the hedgehog with needles, skunk ‚Äì odorous liquid, rose ‚Äì thorns.üòâ
‚†Ä
Thanks for the photo @tatiana.doroshenko_artüåπ

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Ivanovo.¬†üôã¬†Can the creative process be defined as an algorithm of actions?¬†ü§î
‚†Ä
Inspiration inspiration, but a deliberate approach to work has not been canceled! If you correctly build a plan of action, then the process and the result will be pleasing.
‚†Ä
Example of an algorithm for creating colors in the technique of sculptural painting:
üëâ1) prepare the materials (billet, palette knife, decorative plaster)
üëâ2)¬†we study the structure of living flowers from photos
üëâ3) sketch the color scheme (types and number of petals, the structure of leaves)
üëâ4) make a sketch of the composition of future work
üëâ5) number the order of creation of elements (you need to move from left to right from top to bottom)
üëâ6) we work out the technique on the palette
üëâ7) mix the plaster of the desired shade
üëâ8) preparing the background
üëâ9) create flowers
üëâ10) let dry
And remember! The main thing is to take the first step¬†üòâ
‚†Ä

I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with yellow shades in the palette¬†üòâ
Yellow is the color of the sun, the color of the sea sand, the color of spices and ...the color of Imperial clothes in Chinese culture!
‚†Ä
Yellow in China symbolizes the Center of the world, the celestial Empire. During the Qing dynasty, only the Emperor and his family had the right to wear yellow clothes.Wearing a commoner Royal hue was seen as an attempt to usurp the throne, and could cost lives.üò≥
‚†Ä
Here is an interesting story in yellow.
The palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" presents several shades of yellow: French Vanilla, Tea rose and Karri. And soon 2 new colors will be added!
You can buy on the website specified in the profile header, or from my partners.

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Ivanovo. Personal growth coaches say,"What you have today is the result of your choices and actions yesterday."
‚†Ä
It's true. We make choices based actions every day. Choose to sleep or get up early and have time to do an important thing, we choose to do homework or go for a walk with the children, we choose to eat candy and have fun or not to eat, and enjoy a slim figure...
And in teaching the technique of sculptural painting as well!¬† We make a choice: to throw if it is impossible ideally, to recede if it is difficult, to be angry if it is unclear or to train and continue!
‚†Ä
And my students on the online course on sculptural painting choose to train and continue!¬†üí™üëè
The photo work study student Natalia @mokina_nata with the online course.

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Ivanovo.¬†üôã¬†What colors of decorative plaster to use to create paintings? What basic shades should be purchased for the first time?¬†ü§îThese questions arise from beginners in the technique of sculptural painting.
‚†Ä
The minimum set that you will need to work: 1 plaster for the background, 2 for flowers, 2 for leaves, 1 white. For backgrounds, you can use any of the neutral colors:¬†Ash, Beton, Latte, Asphalt, Anthracite, Chocolate, Black carbon and White. For leaves, you can take any two colors from the palette of green shades. If you have pink, white and purple plaster in your work, you can create any flowers from roses to irises. A universal "White" plaster will help you create more additional shades from the available.
‚†Ä
Rina Septina @septina_rina opened the curtain of the technical process and showed what colors she used in her work.¬†üòâ¬†White background, for flowers - Karri, Azalia and Violet, for leaves ‚Äî Nifrite.¬†üëç

I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the color "Latte".üòâ
‚†Ä
Color Latte (with emphasis on the first syllable) ‚Äî a light shade of brown and beige, got its name from the eponymous coffee drink. This word came to us from the Italian language and means - "coffee with milk". In Italy, the emphasis is placed on the first syllable¬†üòâ
‚†Ä
In the palette of decorative plaster color "Latte" is represented by a calm warm shade of light brown. "Latte" neutral color. It can be used to create backgrounds, to blend with other shades, and to create accents in leaves and colors.
Photo thanks to @Rhenevia üåπ
You can buy all the materials for sculptural painting of the brand "Evgenia Ermilova" on the website indicated in the profile header, as well as from my partners.

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Chennai India.¬†üôã¬†Those who see works in the technique of sculptural painting for the first time often confuse them with bas-relief.
The bas-relief is a relief of human figures or objects of any kind.Created from clay, carved from marble or wood, cast from alabaster or bronze.Tools for bas-relief: spatulas, cutters, palette knife, stacks.
‚†Ä
Sculptural painting is an artistic direction that combines elements of sculpture and elements of painting.This technique is also sometimes called "volume" or "relief" painting. Volumetric flowers (and other elements) are created from decorative plaster with a palette knife.
‚†Ä
Put yourself a notice of publication page of the school of sculptural painting, and you will learn a lot about this area of creativity!¬†üòâ
‚†Ä

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Chennai India.üôã
Flowers. Beautiful creatures of nature. They admire the beauty, aroma and grace of lines.üòçPoets praise them in poems and songs, artists ‚Äî in pictures, ordinary people ‚Äî in fairy tales that are passed down from generation to generation. Here's one.
‚†Ä
Cruel and ruthless leader decided to marry a girl from a neighboring tribe. Angry with her refusal, he attacked the village. Having captured the unfortunate, the leader ordered to begin a wedding ceremony. The bride in the white dress threw herself into the fire...
The gods spared the girl and turned her into a wonderful flower. Calla Lily.
Since then, the flower protects girls and helps them in the struggle for their happiness.¬†‚ò∫Ô∏è

‚†Ä
My romance with sculptural painting began when I was still studying at the Institute.¬†üòç¬†First dates were rare and frivolous: I made Breakfast tables and painted with plaster as a contour. Uncertain as the first kisses were attempts to paint with plaster as oil paints.
It was only a few years later that our relations reached a new level. There was decorative plaster, allowing me to create the desired volume, there was a skill to work with two palette knife, which changed our understanding with three-dimensional painting.
‚†Ä
Now I know for sure that our meeting was not accidental.
We with it were created for each other! Sculptural painting ‚Äî to change my life, I ‚Äî to develop it and to acquaint the world with it!
‚†Ä
How did your relationship with sculptural painting begin?üòÑ

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from Chennai India.¬†üôã¬†Every creative person needs to have enough life energy to create! What if the batteries are dead?
‚†Ä
‚úç5 ways to save energy:
üëâ1) switch attention.
Change the environment for a while.Try a radically new occupation.The most productive rest for the brain is new impressions.
üëâ2) relax in nature.
Contact with nature and its powerful energy is a great way to nourish your batteries.
üëâ3) arrange a day of silence.
Turn off gadgets, Internet and TV for a day, stay alone with yourself and your feelings and thoughts.Give your brain a break from the endless flow of information from the outside.
üëâ4) meet with friends.
A good way to open a second wind is to have a good time with good friends. Those who support you, inspire optimism and desire to go forward.
üëâ5) YOUR option
‚†Ä
How do you fill yourself with energy for creativity? Share in the comments.¬†üòâ

India is a country of bright colors, spicy smells and flowers. All living organisms in Hinduism are God's creations. Man has no right to harm them. Therefore, the attitude to the colors of the Indians special!
‚†Ä
A flower in India is not just a plant. Some of their species are used in food, many are used in medicine. The perfect shape of the flower became the prototype of many architectural structures, jewelry and can be traced even in the painting of fabrics.
‚†Ä
Lotus, rose, rhododendron, iris and Orchid ‚Äî the main flowers of India, are associated with love and joy.üòç
‚†Ä
Maybe that's why there are so many people in India who want to get a lesson in sculptural painting by colors?

Among the artists of sculptural painting, only Russian always closely monitor the number of colors in the picture. This is understandable. After all, only in Russia and the former USSR there is a tradition to give bouquets of an even number of flowers as a sign of grief for the dead.
‚†Ä
In other countries, the ratio to the number of flowers in the bouquet is the opposite, and to give an even number is normal.
‚†Ä
In Japan, the bouquet can be from an odd or even number of flowers. The ban is only on the number four. But it is better, according to the Japanese, to give flowers in pots. This gift represents a wish to put down roots.
‚†Ä

Roses are amazing flowers! But even more amazing are the blue roses!¬†üòç
‚†Ä
There are no blue roses in nature. White, yellow, orange, red... But there is no blue! By nature, there is no gene in roses that produces blue pigment. So it was until the XII century.
It was then that the first mention of the azure roses grown in the East. Amazing blue roses were obtained from white varieties, adding a special dye to the roots of flowers or in water.
‚†Ä
In the twenty-first century technology to create a blue rose have entered into a new era of genetic engineering. Scientists were able to identify the enzyme that allows you to "paint" a blue rose by gene modification.
‚†Ä
Whatever way they grow blue roses, they remain the most amazing representatives of their kind. üòç

I continue to introduce you to the decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova".
‚†Ä
Today we get acquainted with the color "Tea rose".üòâ
‚†Ä
Tea rose or fragrant rose ‚Äì a hybrid variety of roses of the genus rosehip. Tea rose was brought to Europe from China with tea on ships in the XIX century.
‚†Ä
The name of this variety was due to the unique aroma peculiar only to roses of this species. The smell of tea rose is vaguely reminiscent of tea. And this is the only variety of roses from which you can prepare a fragrant tea drink.
‚†Ä
The color "Tea rose" in the palette of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" is represented by a delicate salmon-yellow hue, as in one of the varieties of hybrid tea rose.¬†üòç
Delicate color of decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" "Tea rose" is perfect for creating three-dimensional flowers.
‚†Ä

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from the city of Ivanovo.üôã On what surface can decorative plaster be applied?
‚†Ä
Frequently asked question ‚Äî what basis for sculptural painting can be used?
üëâThe best basis is plywood with a thickness greater than 8 mm. The larger the basis, the thicker it should be. Background plaster is applied directly to the base, pre-priming is not necessary.
‚†Ä
You can apply decorative plaster on any surface, even glass. The main thing ‚Äî the strength of the basis, so it can withstand the weight of the elements of the plaster.
The shape of the base can be different and depends on your idea: circle, oval, square, rectangle.

‚†Ä
Decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" contains natural fibers. From plaster it is possible to create both thin petals, and large elements, it is capable to hold volume to 5 cm. After drying becomes strong as a stone. Does not crack when drying while observing the correct drying technology. Almost does not shrink. The catalog contains 45 colors of decorative plaster. And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from the city of Ivanovo. Today in the menu "Bearded irises in a gentle mint sauce".
‚†Ä
For cooking you will need:
1) plywood blank with a thickness of at least 8 mm;
2) decorative plaster brand "Evgenia Ermilova" colors: "Mint", "Pistachio ice cream", "Chocolate", "French vanilla" or "Tea rose", "Lavender mist", "Dusty blue".
‚†Ä
On plywood blank apply a mint layer to give freshness to the future "dish". Add the main ingredients ‚Äî the buds of bearded irises. For rich taste is better to use flowers of different degrees of maturity: from unopened buds to a large flower. The next step is to add the greens to the dish. To spice up the taste, you can add a pinch of "chocolate"to the greens. Well, the final ingredient ‚Äî a beard irises. Leave until ready for 24 hours. Once ready, you can serve "to the table"¬† Bon appetit!üç¥

And again I @evgenia_ermilova broadcast from the city of Ivanovo. üôãProgress (from the Latin "progressus") is a progressive movement forward, an increase in the level of organization.
‚†Ä
Everyone is able to make progress in creativity and in life! It doesn't have to be natural talent, luck, or rich parents. It is important only your desire, diligence and strong character!
‚†Ä
Looking at my old work (in the photo 2016), I realize what a significant creative path I have passed. I see progress in my work. This is the result of many years of work and practice!
‚†Ä
Do you want to become a professional artist in the technique of sculptural painting? Everything is in your hands! Learn, practice, work on your technique. I and my teachers will help you with this üòâ

Once in the forest there was a terrible fire. Terrified, the animals fled in different directions. Only a small Hummingbird bird fluttered over the forest, picking up a few drops of water in its beak, trying to put out the fire.
After a while, other birds and animals broke down and said, "hummingbirds! This is crazy! You think you can put out a fire with a few drops of water?¬ª "No, but I'm doing the best I can," said the little Hummingbird.
‚†Ä
Here is an interesting tale about the great courage of a small bird.üòâ
